# TESS Program G04125

Title: Halo Photometry Of Naked-Eye Stars With TESS

PI: White, Timothy - University Of Sydney

Type: MINI

Summary: The most powerful tests of stellar structure and evolution come from the brightest stars in the night sky, for which complementary observational techniques (such as astrometry, asteroseismology, and interferometry) can be combined. So far, naked-eye stars (V<6) have rarely been observed with high-precision, high-cadence photometry from space telescopes such as Kepler/K2 due to the large number of pixels required to capture the saturated pixel columns. The key goal of this program is to apply the novel technique of 'halo photometry' to perform photometry of extremely bright stars with TESS, and obtain high-precision 2-minute cadence light curves of naked-eye stars.
